title: Morphe drafts in K-beauty influencer Pony to promote spring collection - Global Cosmetics News
text:
TRENDING: Posted by Georgina Caldwell | Jan 21, 2020 | Asia & Australasia, Fashion, Fashion Marketing, Marketing, Products | THE WHAT? Morphe has teamed up with Park Hye Min, a South
Korean influencer popularly known as Pony, according to a report published by
Allure. THE DETAILS The social media star will front the US
brand’s Icy Fantasy spring make-up line and had a hand in its creation to boot –
she’s credited with the creation of 35 pastel shades for the collection’s 351
Icy Fantasy Artistry Palette. “I had so much fun partnering with Morphe on this cool
campaign and I can’t wait to share more with you soon,” Pony posted on Instagram. THE WHY? With 7 million followers on Instagram and a
5 million-strong audience on YouTube, Pony’s influence is considerable, making
her a smart choice for the LA-based brand. What’s more, she’s a tried and
tested beauty partner, having collaborated with MAC last year. Share: Rate: LATEST NEWS Unilever settles in trademark dispute ov...   Walgreens to settle Rite Aid suit for US...
